intro: Eschscholzia absinthiifolia, commonly known as the desert poppy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating adaptability to harsh, dry conditions. Its botanical features include a taproot system and small, lance-shaped foliage. Eschscholzia absinthiifolia is part of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species.
